title: Event
description: An event, e.g. a conference or a convention

version.description: The version of the event schema specification used.

name.description: The complete name of this event, as used on official conference matieral. Must not be empty.

shortName.description: A short form of the event name, fit for use in URLs. Should be reasonably unique, e.g. by incorporating the event year or date. Will be considered to be case insensitive. Has to be at least 3 characters long.

cfpDeadline.description: If the event has published a Call for Papers, this field may contain the deadline.

timezone.description: The timezone to be assumed for event dates. Must be a valid timezone name from the tz database.

organizer.description: The name of the entity organizing this event.
The name of the entity organizing this event.

email.description: The email address to be used as a first point of contact.

isAccessibleForFree.description: If your event is accessible for free, you can flag it here.

languages.description: A list of languages actively used at the event. Should use ISO-639 language tags.

maximumAttendeeCapacity.description: How many people you will admit at a maximum.

location.description: The location of your venue. Recommended to be a string that results in a location in nominatim.openstreetmap.org.

description.description: A longer description of your event. May be interpreted using markdown syntax.

color.description: The event color as a six-digit hexadecimal string.

urls.description: URLs associated with this event. The given properties (home, tickets, schedule, cfp, coc, recordings, logo, organizer) are supported, but you may add your own.

hashtag.description: The hashtag used on social media.

socialMediaAccounts.description: URLs for social media accounts associated with this event. The given properties (twitter, mastodon, instagram) are supported, but you may add your own.

tooling.description: Services and tools used by this event. The given properties (tickets, schedule, website) are supported, but you may add your own.

tags.description: A list of tags associated with this event.
